class homura.callbacks.metrics.MetricCallback(metric: Callable[[collections.abc.Mapping], Any], name: str, logger=None, reduction='average', no_reduce: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: homura.callbacks.base.Callback

Base class of MetricCallback class such as AccuracyCallback

Parameters

  • metric – metric function: (data) -> float

  • name – name of the metric

  • logger –

  • no_reduce – skip reducing when distributed

  • reduction – reduction method after every epoch

after_epoch(data: collections.abc.Mapping)[source]¶
after_iteration(data: collections.abc.Mapping)[source]¶
before_epoch(data: collections.abc.Mapping)[source]¶
before_iteration(data: collections.abc.Mapping)[source]¶
property history¶

History of metric.

Returns

dict of histories in {mode: [history]}

Using this property, history of metrics can be used after a training loop

>>> metric = ...
>>> # training loop
>>> final_result = metric.history["val"][-1]
reduce(tensor)[source]¶
static to_cpu(tensor)[source]¶
homura.callbacks.metrics.metric_callback_decorator(_metric: Callable = None, name: str = None, reduction='average')[source]¶

Decorator to create a metrics callback

>>> @metric_callback_decorator("loss")
>>> def loss(data):
>>>     return data["loss"]

homura.callbacks.saver module¶

class homura.callbacks.saver.WeightSave(save_path: str, save_freq: int = 1)[source]¶

Bases: homura.callbacks.base.Callback

Save weights after every epoch

Parameters

  • save_path – path to be saved

  • save_freq – frequency of saving in epoch. If -1, saved by after_all.
